metadata.title: CVE-2019-12068 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
In QEMU 1:4.1-1, 1:2.1+dfsg-12+deb8u6, 1:2.8+dfsg-6+deb9u8,1:3.1+dfsg-8~deb10u1, 1:3.1+dfsg-8+deb10u2, and 1:2.1+dfsg-12+deb8u12(fixed), when executing script in lsi_execute_script(), the LSI scsiadapter emulator advances 's->dsp' index to read next opcode. This can leadto an infinite loop if the next opcode is empty. Move the existing loopexit after 10k iterations so that it covers no-op opcodes as well.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-12068` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

qemu - 1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu10.42
qemu-block-extra - 1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu10.42
qemu-guest-agent - 1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu10.42
qemu-kvm - 1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu10.42
qemu-system - 1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu10.42
qemu-system-aarch64 - 1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu10.42
qemu-system-arm - 1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu10.42
qemu-system-common - 1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu10.42
qemu-system-mips - 1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu10.42
qemu-system-misc - 1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu10.42
qemu-system-ppc - 1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu10.42
qemu-system-s390x - 1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu10.42
qemu-system-sparc - 1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu10.42
qemu-system-x86 - 1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu10.42
qemu-user - 1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu10.42
qemu-user-binfmt - 1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu10.42
qemu-user-static - 1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu10.42
qemu-utils - 1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu10.42
No subscription required

criterions.comment: qemu package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu10.42').
